questionText: Find the missing number: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?

A is the brother of B. B is the son of C. D is the father of C. How is A related to D?
Pointing to a girl, A said, 'She is the daughter of my grandfather's only son.' How is the girl related to A?
P is the father of Q, who is the mother of R. How is P related to R?
A man said, 'That lady is my mother's only son's wife.' Who is the lady to the man?
Pointing to a boy, Rita said, 'He is the son of my grandfather's daughter.' How is the boy related to Rita?
A man walks 3 km north, then 4 km east, then 5 km south. How far is he from the starting point?
A person walks 10 km west, then 5 km south. What is the shortest distance from his starting point?
A walks 4 km north, then turns right and walks 3 km, then turns right again and walks 4 km. How far is A from the starting point?
A man is facing west. He turns 90° clockwise, then 180° anticlockwise. Which direction is he facing?
X walks 10 km north, then 6 km west, then 10 km south. How far is he from the starting point?
Five people A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row. A is left of B but right of C. D is right of B. Who is in the middle?
Six friends are sitting around a circular table. P is to the left of Q and opposite to R. Who is sitting between Q and R?
Four friends are sitting in a line. A is to the right of B. C is to the left of D. Who is sitting at the extreme ends?
Five boys are standing in a line. R is taller than S but shorter than T. U is taller than T but shorter than V. Who is the tallest?
Four persons A, B, C, D are standing in a square. A is north of B. D is east of C. Who is diagonally opposite to A?
Statements: All dogs are cats. All cats are animals. Conclusions: (i) All dogs are animals (ii) All animals are cats.
Statements: Some pens are pencils. Some pencils are erasers. Conclusions: (i) Some pens are erasers (ii) Some pencils are pens.
Statements: No book is a pen. Some pens are pencils. Conclusions: (i) Some books are pencils (ii) No pencil is a book.
Statements: All flowers are trees. Some trees are green. Conclusions: (i) Some flowers are green (ii) All trees are flowers.
Statements: All apples are fruits. No fruit is a vegetable. Conclusions: (i) Some apples are vegetables (ii) No apple is a vegetable.
